did.unittitle: Philadelphia Museum of Art Public Relations Department records

bioghist.p: For many years the Museum hired publicity agents through the Director's Office. In 1950 the first full-time press representative was appointed, and there has been a Public Relations Department ever since.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records related to the Museum's Public Relations department. Records include Museum press releases and newspaper clippings from the 1920's to very recently. Also included are some departmental correspondence, brochures, posters and minutes of the Public Relations Committee (1964-1975). The bulk of the collection consists of 64 scrapbooks (1927-1972) that primarily contain newspaper clippings which feature or simply mention the museum. Magazine articles are also included and, to a lesser extent, ephemera and photographs from newspapers across the country. Includes correspondence related to publications of the museum (correspondence of Frederick King and Calvin Hathaway, both editors of the Museum's publications) and some correspondence related to the publication of the Pennsylvania Museum Bulletin, edited by Paul Vanderbilt; Also correspondence of Sandra Horrocks from the 1970s.
